answers.answer: Hi there.The more common explanation for this in the setting of diabetes is that of diabetic neuropathy.  this means that the nerves are chronically damaged by the prolonged elevation in blood sugars.  This can manifest with numbness and if the blood vessels in the brain are also affected, this can manifest with dizziness.However, due to the previous history of breast cancer, it is best to work this up as if related to cancer until proven otherwise.  I believe that brain imaging may be necessary such as a CT scan, and I suggest you discuss this with your doctor.Regards.

question: Hello,my mom ' s head feeling numbs all the time. She keeps queeze her head and feel dizzy . We asked the doctor but she said it very hard to diagnosis.  My mom is diabetic and history of breast cancer. She is taking lipitor, lizinoprils 5mg and Actos. Please help because she feels very discomfort, she keeps crying because she doesn't know how to explain it. Thank you.
title: head feeling numbs
